alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Musselshell; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 6:08PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Golden Valley and Musselshell. In south central Montana, Yellowstone. The heaviest rain fell over Dewey Creek and Goulding Creek in Musselshell County. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 602 PM MDT, Heavy rain due to thunderstorms fell during the afternoon, with radar estimates of 1 to 2.5 inches of rainfall in a short time. The heavy rain may cause minor flooding. - Showers have turned light, and additional heavy rain is not expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Golden Valley, Southwestern Musselshell and Northwestern Yellowstone Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
